intro: Senecio matricariifolius, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring serrated, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Senecio matricariifolius is known for its ability to spread rapidly and can become invasive in certain regions.
